info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 04 at 12:34PM MST until January 06 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 4 PM PST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 6 inches expected tonight and Wednesday, with an additional 4 to 7 inches possible Thursday through Friday morning. Mixed precipitation and some freezing rain is also possible Thursday and Friday. * WHERE...Camas Prairie, Grangeville and vicinity, Greer Grade, Highway 95 Slate Creek to Riggins, and White Bird Grade. * WHEN...From 4 PM this afternoon to 4 PM PST Thursday. * TIMING...The snow will come in two waves, the first wave will be tonight through Wednesday and 1 to 6 inches of snow are expected. The second wave will start Wednesday night, when the heaviest precipitation is expected. Thursday snow levels will rise causing a transition to rain and potentially some freezing rain. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
